title: Vehicles in events in Coahuila, Mexico
name: Vehicles in events in Coahuila, Mexico

properties.details: Young men traveling in orange cars were suspected responsible for the arson.
properties.basictitle: Police Substation Burned in Colonia Ampliacion La Rosita, Torreon, Mexico
properties.event summary: 09/18/2011: On Sunday morning at 0530, in Colonia Ampliacion La Rosita, Torreon, Coahuila, Mexico, a substation belonging to the Torreon Municipal Police was set on fire.  The station was burned intentionally using gasoline sprayed on the building. The substation at the La Rosita expansion received extensive damage, burning the interior, some furniture and a television.  The attack, along with two other arsons, caused the deaths of 21 Torreon officers, and left more than 50 wounded.  No group claimed responsibility for the attack, however, police suspect some young men who were seen driving orange cars.
properties.location: The arson took place at the Torreon Municipal Police sub-station in Colonia Ampliacion La Rosita, Torreon, Coahuila, Mexico.

properties.details: The suspects were driving an orange car.
properties.basictitle: Police Substation Burned in Nueva California, Torreon, Mexico
properties.event summary: 09/18/2011:  On Sunday morning at 0530, in Colonia Nuevo California, Torreon, Coahuila, Mexcio, a substation belonging to the Torreon Municipal Police was set on fire.  The station was burned intentionally using gasoline sprayed on the building.  The station received damages to the exterior of the building.  The attack, along with two other arsons, caused the deaths of 21 Torreon officers, and left more than 50 wounded.  No group claimed responsibility for the arson, however, police suspected some young men who were seen driving orange cars in the area.
properties.location: The arson took place at the Torreon Municipal Police sub-station in Colonia Nuevo California, Coahuila, Mexico.

properties.basictitle: Los Zetas Members Launch Attacks on Army Troops After Arrest of Castillo in Coahuila, Mexico
properties.event summary: 10/12/2011: On Wednesday in Saltillo, Coahuila, Mexico, alleged members of Los Zetas launched two attacks on members of the Mexican army after they arrested Carlos Oliva Castillo, a key member of Los Zetas. It was believed that the attacks were a rescue attempt, but it was unsuccessful. No casualties were reported. During the two rescue attempts, four firearms, 40 magazines, 583 rounds of ammunition, and four vehicles were seized. No group claimed responsibility, but Los Zetas members are highly suspected.
properties.location: The incident occurred in multiple areas of Saltillo, Coahuila, Mexico.

properties.details: Public Ministry personnel seized two license plates from Coahuila.
properties.basictitle: Public Ministry Personnel Located Bodies, Vehicles, and Firearms in Saltillo, Coahuila
properties.event summary: 11/22/2011: On Tuesday, near the intersection of Calle Sor Juana Ines de la Cruz and Calle Luis G. Urbina in the Colonia Lamadrid, Saltillo, Coahuila, Mexico, Public Ministry personnel arrived to a scene responding to a report about an armed confrontation between military personnel and armed group. Public Ministry personnel recovered four male bodies with bullet wounds inside of white Chevrolet Tahoe without license plates. In addition, Public Ministry personnel seized the following: four rifles, including .223 caliber and 7.62x39 millimeter rifles, 17 .223 caliber and 7.62x39 millimeter magazines, 548 .223 caliber rounds, 189 7.62x39 millimeter rounds, and two license plates from Coahuila.
properties.location: The incident occurred near the intersection of Calle Sor Juana Ines de la Cruz and Calle Luis G. Urbina in the Colonia Lamadrid, Saltillo, Coahuila, Mexico.

properties.details: The State police seized two grey Volkswagen Bora vehicles and one red Dakota vehicle.
properties.basictitle: Armed Group Attacked the State Police in Saltillo, Coahuila
properties.event summary: 12/07/2011: On Wednesday, in Saltillo, Coahuila, Mexico, an armed group attacked the State Police. Authorities received reports that suspicious individuals were seen in Colonia Mirasierra. A convoy of six vehicles of gunmen assaulted Saltillo State police. State police pursued the gunmen through different parts of Colonia Mirasierra. They rescued two people who were kidnapped by the gunmen. One of the kidnapped victims died on the way to the hospital, and one gunman died in the confrontation. State police seized three AR-15 rifles, two grey Volkswagen Bora vehicles, and one red Dakota vehicle. Several vehicles with bullet holes were abandoned in the area.
properties.location: The incident occurred in Colonia Mirasierra, Saltillo, Coahuila, Mexico.
